t: Pontiac Firebird - Wikipedia
s: February 10, 2025 - The Pontiac Firebird is an American automobile built and produced by Pontiac from the 1967 to 2002 model years. Designed as a pony car to compete with the Ford Mustang, it was introduced on February 23, 1967, five months after GM's Chevrolet division's platform-sharing Camaro.

t: GM Makes Official Statement About 'Pontiac Is Back' Ad
s: May 24, 2024 - Unfortunately, GM’s statement confirms that the ad was indeed merely a joke and not indicative of any actual plans to revive the brand. Bummer. Pontiac, known for iconic models like the GTO and Firebird, was discontinued in 2010 during GM’s financial restructuring.

t: Make Some Noise Pontiac is Back! Car&Driver May/June 2024 Issue | Pontiac Solstice Forum
s: Good point on the Firebird logo and I could see monetizing Pontiac as a “model”, but not as a Division. It being GM, it would be very “on brand” to give up the pretense that was the rebranding factory of the later year Pontiac as a division, and instead just badge up some Chevys as a test.

t: Pontiac Firebird (third generation) - Wikipedia
s: 4 days ago - For 1982, the new Firebird had ... anything GM had ever tried before), flush-mounted side glass, and for the first time, a large, glass-dominated rear hatchback. Electronically controlled retractable headlamps, and a rounded hoodline and front fenders were the primary characteristics that distinguished the Firebird from its Camaro sibling and its previous Firebird incarnations.
